newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Some bidding details of Brazil CVRD sale.
newsitem.headline: Some bidding details of Brazil CVRD sale.

text.p: The two consortia bidding for a controlling stake of Brazilian mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) will have to buy a minimum of 41.7 percent of voting shares and a maximum of 45 percent.

The minimum price for a 41.7 percent stake or 104.31 million shares is 2.782 billion reais, according to a statement from the Rio de Janeiro bolsa where the auction will be held once the government quashes several injunctions.
The minimum price for a 45 percent stake or 112.49 million shares is 3.0 billion reais.
Bidding will go up at 0.01 real a go, with auctioneer Alexandre Runtes having the right to raise the value.
The bidding will not be divided into lots, but will take place in per share terms.
Ten minutes after the end of the auction, the winner will inform the stock exchange of exactly how many shares it bought and how they will be distributed among its partners.
Brokers Fonte Cindam are representing the Valepar consortium led by Brazilian steelmaker CSN.
Bozano, Simonsen is the brokerage for the Valecom consortium, headed by local metal, pulp and cement group Votorantim and South Africa's Anglo American Corp.
